Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum scored 37 points as the Boston Celtics launched the defense of their NBA crown with an emphatic 132-109 defeat of the New York Knicks.

A devastating 43-point first quarter put Boston in complete control during the first half, with Tatum producing an electric shooting performance to pour in 18 points from 3-point range over the two quarters.

Four of the Celtics' five starters — Tatum, Jaylen Brown, Derrick White and Jrue Holiday — posted double-digit points tallies before halftime, helping the team take a commanding 74-55 lead into the break.
Tatum finished with 10 assists and four rebounds in addition to his 37 points, with White adding 24 points and Brown 23. Holiday added 18 while Al Horford chipped in with 11.
Jalen Brunson led the Knicks scoring with 22 points, alongside Miles McBride with 22 from the bench.
Pre-Game Insights: After a pregame ceremony that saw Boston celebrate raising its record-breaking 18th championship banner, the Celtics delivered a performance that suggested they could well be the team to beat once more.
Tatum had brought the house down in a pregame address to a packed TD Garden, signaling the Celtics' determination to win back-to-back championships.
Post-Match Reflections: Tatum told the crowd, 'This is special. On behalf of me, my teammates, the organization, we couldn't have done it without you last year. Let's enjoy this moment together. I can honestly say, to the best fans in the world — let's do it again.'
